# Meta-Analysis

## The effect of imputation
### Comparison of fit statistics
- The absolute fit statistics are not comparable across models based on different imputations. Relative, however, the models show the same patterns: Lower AIC of LUI model compared to the grand mean model, lowest AIC for the full (=select) model: 

```{r}
### BASED ON MEAN OF IMPUTATION
# Fit statistics for species richness
kable(read.csv(path2temp %+% "fit.tab.richness.csv"), digits=3)

# Fit statistics for yield
kable(read.csv(path2temp %+% "fit.tab.yield.csv"), digits=3)

### MULTIPLE IMPUTATION
# Fit statistics for species richness
kable(read.csv(path2temp %+% "ModelsAvgImp_fit.tab.richness.csv"), digits=3)

# Fit statistics for yield
kable(read.csv(path2temp %+% "ModelsAvgImp_fit.tab.yield.csv"), digits=3)

```

### Comparison of parameter estimates
- The more covariables the less (relative) differences in parameter estimates caused by imputation. 
- Partly huge differences in parameter estimates between the two approaches:
